_description: Charm to rid worms — four roughly-rhyming couplets

HunHM58.Transcription:
Iob in a donghill laye thre wormis did hem ffraythe one was
                    whitte the therde was blacke the second was redI bede a bonne to almyghti
                    god that thes wormis mowght be dedeGod & our lady grant hit be
                    mowteIn the name of the father & of the Svnne & of the holye
                    goste& of the holy trynyteiii persons & one god Amen a pone
                    Charite
HunHM58.Note:
Added to originally blank space between texts by a hand of the sixteenth
                    century; four rough couplets.
HunHM58.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 247-8.
